docs.snippet: Cote, a new restaurant in the Flatiron district, styles itself as a steakhouse, with dry-aged beef and a nicely priced menu option.

headline.print_headline: Putting the Beef Into Korean Barbecue
headline.main: This May Be the Best Beef at Any Korean BBQ in New York

docs.snippet: Coins and paper currency remain the most popular ways to pay in most countries. But longer term, cash appears to be locked in a losing battle with electronic payment methods.
At the Smart Kitchen Summit in Seattle, they talked of appliances that plan, shop, advise — and leave little room for the joy of cooking.

headline.main: Kitchen of the Future: Smart and Fast but Not Much Fun

docs.snippet: Feel like bending an elbow? The Threesome Tollbooth, in Bushwick, practically requires you to in order to fit into the place.

headline.main: At This Brooklyn Bar, It’s Just You, Your Date and the Barman

docs.snippet: Tuesday: Talking to Daniel Humm of Eleven Madison Park, the Brooklyn Podcast festival, and readers respond to subway announcements.

headline.main: New York Today: A Renowned Chef’s Advice for Beginners

docs.snippet: Wednesday: Dog owners’ opinions on rentable doghouses, a traveling David Bowie exhibition, and a foodie firestorm.

headline.main: New York Today: Parking Your Pooch

docs.snippet: Indulge a little: Gabrielle Hamilton offers a great new recipe for duck breast with braised endive, or try Alison Roman’s baked ziti.
“The Museum of the Old Colony” is a photo-based installation exploring the complicated – and unequal – relationship between Puerto Rico and the United States.

headline.main: A New Museum for an Old Colony, Puerto Rico

docs.abstract: “The Museum of the Old Colony” is a photo-based installation exploring the complicated – and unequal – relationship between Puerto Rico and the United States.

docs.snippet: The novelist Harlan Coben visits a 1950s nuclear-missile command-and-control center in Livingston, N.J., that figures in his latest thriller.

headline.print_headline: Roaming the Woods, Imagining Gunfire on a Cold War Base
headline.main: Imagining Murder at a Cold War Command Post With Harlan Coben
